identificationModule.briefTitle: The Effect of Instant Message Intervention for Psychological Well-being Among Stroke Survivors
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Effect of Instant Message Intervention for Psychological Well-being Among Stroke Survivors

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The proposed pilot trial aims to evaluate the feasibility of iCBT based EMI, which is a real-time, real-world, personalised and cost-effective approach, for stroke survivors' psychological well-being.

armGroups.label: Intervention group
armGroups.description: Receive iCBT based EMI with message content, delivery frequency and timing personalised to participants' preferences.

armGroups.label: Control group
armGroups.description: Receive general mental health information through instant message.

interventions.name: iCBT-based EMI
interventions.description: Consists of brief iCBT for psychological support (mandatory), stroke care education (optional), and real-time chat-based support messages, delivered according to participants' preferences.

primaryOutcomes.description: A 9-item scale with score ranging from 0 to 27, higher scores indicate higher severity of depressive symptom

secondaryOutcomes.description: A 7-item scale with score ranging from 0 to 21, higher scores indicate higher severity of anxiety symptoms
A 4-item scale with score ranging from 0 to 16, higher scores indicate higher severity of stress

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Spiritual well-being (Sub-scale of Spirituality Scale for Chinese Elders [SSCE])
secondaryOutcomes.description: An 8-item scale with score ranging from 0 to 32, higher scores indicate better spiritual well-being
An 8-item scale with score ranging from 8 to 32, higher scores indicate higher level of loneliness

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Diagnosis of stroke (ICD-10 codes: I60-I69)
* Aged ≥18
* Able to read and communicate in Chinese (Cantonese or Putonghua)
* Able to use text messaging function on mobile phones
* MoCA 5-minute Protocol (cognitive screen) ≥14 (Equivalence to MMSE ≥ 21)
* Discharged home from hospital within preceding 6 months
* PHQ-9 (depressive symptom) score range from 5 to 19 (cf. mild: 5-9, moderate: 10-14, moderately severe: 15-19 and severe: 20-27)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Currently receiving active stroke care in acute or post-acute inpatient settings
* Has diagnosis of psychiatric disease or is currently taking psychotropic drug
* PHQ-9 ≥ 20 (i.e., severe depressive symptom)
* Currently participating in any type of psychological intervention (e.g., CBT)
